cvbyte.info: Bits 0-6 contain an address with a value between 1 and 127. Bit seven must have a value of 0.
Vstart is used to define the voltage drive level used as the start voltage on the motor.
Determines the decoder's acceleration rate.
Determines a decoders braking rate.
Vhigh is used to specify the motor voltage drive levels at the maximum speed step.

Vmid specifies the voltage drive level at the middle speed step. Vmid is used to generate a performance curve in the decoder that translate speed step values into motor voltage drive levels and is specified as a fraction of available rectified supply voltage.
This is reserved for the manufacturer to store information regarding the version of the decoder.
CV8 shall contain the NMRA assigned id number of the manufacturer of this decoder.
The value of CV#9 sets the nominal PWM period at the decoder output and therefore the frequency is proportional to the reciprocal of the value.

Contains a value between 1 and 128 that indicates the speed step above which the back EMF motor control cuts off. When 14 or 28 speed steps are used the LSB's of the value are truncated appropriately.
Contains the maximum time period that the decoder will maintain its speed without receiving a valid packet addressed to it.
Contains the identity of the alternate power source to be converted to should CV #1 contain all zeros.
Indicates the status of each function (F1 through F8) when the unit is operating in alternate power mode, which cannot control the functions.
Indicates the status of each function (F9 through F12 and FL) when the unit is operating in alternate power mode, which cannot control the functions.
The decoder lock is used to change CV's in only one of several decoders with the same short address (CV1) or long address (CV17 and CV18) that are installed in the same locomotive.
The decoder lock is used to change CV's in only one of several decoders with the same short address (CV1) or long address (CV17 and CV18) that are installed in the same locomotive.

The Extended Address is the locomotives address when the decoder is set up for extended addressing (indicated by a value of 1 in bit location 5 of CV#29). CV#17 contains the most significant bits of the two byte address and must have a value between 11000000 and 11100111, inclusive, in order for this two byte address to be valid. CV 18 contains the least significant bits of the address and may contain any value.

The Extended Address is the locomotives address when the decoder is set up for extended addressing (indicated by a value of 1 in bit location 5 of CV#29). CV#17 contains the most significant bits of the two byte address and must have a value between 11000000 and 11100111, inclusive, in order for this two byte address to be valid. CV 18 contains the least significant bits of the address and may contain any value.

Contains a seven bit address in bit positions 0-6. Bit 7 indicates the relative direction of this unit within a consist, with a value of 0 indicating normal direction, and a value of 1 indicating a direction opposite the unit's normal direction. If the seven bit address in bits 0-6 is 0000000 the unit is not in a consist.
Defines for functions F1-F8 whether the function is controlled by the consist address.
Defines for function FL whether the function is controlled by the consist address.

This Configuration Variable contains additional acceleration rate information that is to be added to or subtracted from the base value contained in Configuration Variable #3 using the formula (the contents of CV#23*.896)/(number of speed steps in use).

This Configuration Variable contains additional braking rate information that is to be added to or subtracted from the base value contained in Configuration Variable #4 using the formula (the contents of CV#24*.896)/(number of speed steps in use).
A value between 2 and 127 shall be used to indicate 1 of 126 factory preset speed tables.
Used to configure which actions will cause the decoder to automatically stop.
Used to Configure decoder's Bi-Directional communication characteristics when CV29-Bit 3 is set.
Configuration for direction, addressing, speed steps, RailCom and DC operation.
In the case where the decoder has an error condition this Configuration Variable shall contain the error condition as specified by the manufacturer. A value of 0 indicates that no error has occurred.
Primary index for CV 257-51
Secondary index for CV 257-51
Specifies the amount of extra Kick that will supplied to the motor when transitioning between stop and the first speed step.
Specifies a scale factor by which a voltage drive level should be multiplied, when the controller is driving the unit in the forward direction.
Specifies a scale factor by which a voltage drive level should be multiplied, when the controller is driving the unit in reverse.
